title: Linux psnice Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the psnice command in Linux, learn how to adjust process priority, and discover practical use cases for managing system processes efficiently.

meta.title: Linux psnice Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the psnice command in Linux, learn how to adjust process priority, and discover practical use cases for managing system processes efficiently.
meta.keywords: Linux, process management, psnice, priority, system performance, process optimization

verify.name: Verify the nice value of the current bash process
verify.hint: The nice value of the current bash process should be set to -5 after running the `psnice` command.

verify.name: Verify the nice value of the sleep process
verify.hint: The nice value of the sleep process should be set to -5 after using the `psnice` command to increase its priority.

steps.title: Practical Use Cases of the psnice Command

verify.name: Verify the nice value of the background process
verify.hint: The nice value of the background process should be 0 (default priority) since we did not change its priority using `psnice`.

verify.name: Verify the nice value of the web server process
verify.hint: The nice value of the web server process should be -5 after using `psnice` to increase its priority.
